snippet: The film, which shows scenes of prostitutes in Marrakesh servicing wealthy Saudi clients, had its premiere at the Cannes Film Festival.
abstract: Mustapha Khalfi, Morocco's communications minister, defends decision to ban Nabil Ayouch film Much Loved, which depicts prostitutes servicing Saudi clients in Marrakesh.
lead_paragraph: The film, which shows scenes of prostitutes in Marrakesh servicing wealthy Saudi clients, had its premiere at the Cannes Film Festival.

headline.main: Morocco Defends Ban of ‘Much Loved’; Attack on Actor Is Called Unrelated
